title: AI-Powered Medical Diagnosis System
description: Developing machine learning models to assist physicians in diagnosing complex medical conditions using multimodal data including medical imaging, laboratory results, and clinical notes. This project aims to create interpretable AI models that can provide diagnostic recommendations while maintaining transparency in clinical decision-making.

publications.title: Machine Learning Applications in Medical Diagnosis: A Comprehensive Review

datasets.name: Multimodal Clinical Dataset
datasets.description: De-identified clinical data including imaging, lab results, and clinical notes from 10,000 patients

title: Precision Medicine Through Genomic Data Integration
description: Leveraging machine learning to integrate genomic, proteomic, and clinical data for personalized treatment recommendations. This project focuses on developing algorithms that can predict drug responses and identify optimal treatment pathways for individual patients based on their genetic profiles.

publications.title: Genomic Data Integration for Precision Medicine: Challenges and Opportunities

datasets.name: Integrated Genomic-Clinical Dataset
datasets.description: Genomic sequences and clinical outcomes for 5,000 patients across multiple disease categories

title: Natural Language Processing for Clinical Documentation
description: Developing advanced NLP techniques to extract meaningful insights from unstructured clinical notes and improve healthcare documentation efficiency. The project includes automated coding, clinical decision support, and quality metrics extraction from free-text medical records.

datasets.name: De-identified Clinical Notes Corpus
datasets.description: Large corpus of de-identified clinical notes for NLP research and development

title: AI-Accelerated Drug Discovery Platform
description: Building a comprehensive AI platform for accelerating drug discovery processes, from target identification to clinical trial optimization. The platform integrates molecular modeling, pharmacokinetics prediction, and clinical outcome forecasting.
fundingSource: Pending NIH Grant Application R01-GM234567 ($3.2M over 3 years)
